intro: Hemitelia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
